title: The Office Lines Analysis
text:
# load in packages
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(knitr)

# import data set
office_lines <- read.csv("the-office_lines.csv")

# filter out Jim's lines when he says "Pam" in every season
Jim_lines <- office_lines |>
  filter(Character == "Jim") |>
  filter(str_detect(Line, "\\bPam[a-z]*\\b")) |>
  group_by(Season, Episode_Number) |>
  summarize(n = n(), .groups = "drop") 

# plot of Jim's frequency of the word "Pam"
ggplot(Jim_lines, aes(x = Episode_Number, y = n, fill = Season)) +
  geom_col() +
  labs(
    x = "Episode Number",
    y = "# of 'Pam' Occurrences", 
    title = "How Many Times Jim Said 'Pam' in 'The Office'"
  )








The Office, although heavily referred to as a “comedy,” has one of the most popular romantic couples in television sitcom history: Jim and Pam. In this analysis, I counted how many times Jim said the name “Pam” / “Pamela” per episode in every season. The graph is also color-coded by season: getting a lighter shade of blue as the seasons progress. Based on the data, Jim said the name “Pam” the most on episode 4 collectively throughout every season, and this trend would decrease the longer a season went on. Ultimately, Jim referenced “Pam” in 123 episodes throughout the course of the TV show.

# detect whenever somebody laughs
laugh_counts <- office_lines |>
  filter(str_detect
         (str_to_lower
           (str_trim(Line)), "\\[laughing\\]|\\[laughs\\]")) |>
  group_by(Episode_Number, Season) |>
  summarize(n = n()) |>
  arrange(desc(n))

# create a table indicating laugh counts
kable(laugh_counts, caption = "Summary of Laugh Counts by Character and Episode")

title: Employed Women
text:
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
employed_gender <- read.csv("employed_gender.csv")
ggplot(employed_gender, aes(x = year, y = full_time_female)) +
  geom_point(color = "hotpink") +
  labs(
    x = "Year",
    y = "% Of Women Employed Full-Time",
    title = "Women Employed Full-Time Per Year",
  )








Code from: tidytuesday/data/2019/2019-03-05/employed_gender.csv at master · rfordatascience/tidytuesday (github.com)

title: About Me
text: Hi! My name is Kandace Loualhati (Loo-uhl-haw-tee). I’m currently a second year at Pomona College who’s intending on double majoring in Politics and Cognitive Science (with a computational concentration). I’m also a coffee addict (whoops!), an avid adventurer, and have my Seal of Biliteracy in American Sign Language :)

title: California Fire Damage
text:
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
 calfire_damage <- read.csv("calfire_damage.csv")
ggplot(calfire_damage, aes(x = year, y = structures)) +
  geom_point(color = "orange") +
  labs(
    x = "Year",
    y = "Numbers of Structures Destroyed",
    title = "California Fire Damage Per Year",
  )








Code from: tidytuesday/data/2018/2018-08-21/calfire_damage.csv at master · rfordatascience/tidytuesday (github.com)
